docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: The latest report on the health perils of obesity (''Panel Terms Obesity a Major U.S. Killer Needing Top Priority,'' Feb. 14) reminds me of the farmer who told the county agricultural agent who was trying to give him advice, ''I already know how to farm 10 times better than I do.'' Fat people are already persecuted by social ostracism, job discrimination, poor self-image, etc.

byline.original: By Susan Heller Anderson and David W. Dunlap

docs.lead_paragraph: Although a panel convened by the National Institutes of Health in Bethesda, Md., was weighing the implications of obesity, Erma Bombeck had made her own study in Manhattan. She sat in that Mecca of the Matzoh Ball, the Carnegie Delicatessen, 854 Seventh Avenue, near 55th Street, eating a lettuce leaf and drinking a Perrier.
